reviews.text: My family and I took the holiday package at Marriott Putrajaya for a weekend escape. Prior arrival, Surati from reservation confirmed with me via email for early check in and a late check out. She also confirmed breakfast reservation via email for my family. So we I thought this was great! Unfortunately, none of the above was delivered! !
reviews.title: Not a 5 star hotel.

reviews.text: Check in process took more than 45mins. My room was not ready for early check in as promised. So after expressed my disappointment, they upgraded me to deluxe room with a view. My jaws dropped when I stepped in to the room eg an outdated room with wet carpet smell, a view with a whole bunch of trees in front of the small balcony, old furnitures and this is definitely not a deluxe room cateogry at a 5 star hotel. Hence I complained and they upgraded me to executive deluxe room with golf view. I must say that was a much better room because it is abit newer and cleaner. I was told that I was able to enjoy the executive lounge benefits but due to lack of proper communications, the senior butler told me I wasn't till they clarified with the staff at reception who gave me an upgrade. What a mess! The door bell in my room doesn't work. So you can imagine how well the hotel is maintained. It's a 11 yrs old hotel and the staff told me there isn't any major refurbishment.
reviews.title: A great improvement

reviews.text: You don't have to be excited even though you get to enjoy the benefits at the executive lounge. I was very disappointed with the food served at the lounge. Do not expect for canapes and cocktails. Ambience at the lounge is average. And they were rushing to close the food counter 30mins before it's times up. Not sensitive to guests who were just arrived at the lounge or go an extra mile to make a difference.
reviews.title: Marriott - Putrajaya

reviews.text: Swimming pool is huge. They have 3 pools and one specifically for kids with a slide. But the slide doesn't work because the water doesn't come out from the pump to make the slide slippery enough for kids to enjoy. We found the pool need to improve its hygiene. Our kids nevertheless still enjoy themselves.
reviews.title: Substandard

reviews.text: Breakfast at Zest was good. They have quite a wide selections. I like the roti canai counter but it was a shame that they did not prepare enough to accommodate their guests. We also like the mee mamak. Fresh juices counter had a long quene and seems like they were lack of manpower. We had a decent breakfast to start our day. Again do not expect quality breakfast like other 5 stars hotels.
reviews.title: pleasant stay

reviews.text: As a hotel that hold the brand of Marriott, Marriott Putrajaya does stand out to be a great place to stay. The spacious lobby is gives a warm- relaxing welcome.
reviews.title: Relaxing Experience

reviews.text: Try to get a room at higher levels to have a better view of the landscape. If you are facing the golf course - you may be able to catch a glimpse of twin tower, from far of course...
reviews.title: Great Stay at the Marriott

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are a good number of restraurants in the hotel but not all of the restraurants are open on Sunday - at least not the Mexican-American Grill bar, which i find a little bit of dissapointment. Good thing is - there are other options available.
reviews.title: The devil in the detail

reviews.text: Not much local attractions within 3-5 km except the buildings of admistrations for local government. However, there are free shutter bus to shopping malls and eateries place.
reviews.title: My stay

reviews.text: As the hotel is obviously built for golfers, it is too much for a guest on business trip.
reviews.title: Nice Stay

reviews.text: This hotel is beautiful with several dining choices; very close to Putrajaya and Cyberjaya and is popular with business travelers who work in that area. If you're in this group, then I'd definitely recommend it.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, but inconvenient to KL

reviews.text: Have stayed there 3 times on business over the past 4 months and have had a good stay.
reviews.title: Excellent Staff but the hotel needs a lift

reviews.text: The hotel is set in a nice location and is suitable for a get away, with close access to Airport and local malls as well as a nice pool area if you just want to relax.
reviews.title: Mouldy smell with cockroach in the room

reviews.text: The rooms are excellent in the Executive area where I stayed, and the staff in the Business lounge are really welcoming and cant do enough for you.
reviews.title: Satisfying

reviews.text: The general areas in the hotel though could do with some paint and this let down the hotel abit.
reviews.title: Perfect 5-star hotel

reviews.text: The pool area was pleasant, although why they did not serve any drinks there when they had bottles on display I do not know. OK you could phone Room Service from a phone at the bar and they would come and bring drinks/food to you by the pool, but why the people in the pool area could not do this for you I do not know.
reviews.title: Breakfast with flies

reviews.text: We spent one night here last week with a friend's family, and had a lovely refreshing stay, despite a problematic beginning.
reviews.title: another getaway for cityfolk

reviews.text: Once we had checked in, we found that only one electricity point worked in the room - the foyer light, everything else didn't function.. We had to call repeatedly for someone to come and check this out - finally when the technicians came to attend to the problem, they said that it was a major one, and we would have to change rooms. Then there was another long wait before the reception people came up to give us our new room. So we wasted more than an hour after checking in before we could actually settle in - this caused stress instead of allowing us to chill out as soon as we arrived!
reviews.title: Nice Stay Away From the City

reviews.text: Luckily, after that things were good. The new room (which was next door) was much better. The first room, even before we discovered the power problem, didn't impress us very much - there was a huge pillar outside the window, and the window was only half glass, the bottom half was a wall. The second room was bigger with an all glass window and no pillar outside.
reviews.title: Away from the hustle and bustle

reviews.text: We ended up having dinner in the hotel, as everyone was too lazy to drive out for food. The buffet dinner was extensive, and the staff very kindly didn't charge for the two 9 year olds, so the price wasn't too terrible.
reviews.title: Not the best location for KL central places of interest

reviews.text: The gym was pretty well equipped, and overlooked the pools and grounds, which made my stint on the treadmill pleasant. Our kids loved the pools.
reviews.title: A bit of a disappointment
